dialogs.line: Ah, a traveler! You look like you’ve seen better days. That town back there isn’t always kind to those who walk a different path.
They’re wary of change, but don’t let that discourage you. New beginnings often lie beyond the hardest doors.
Speaking of new beginnings, let me offer you something. This armor is fine-crafted, and worthy of any warrior. It will shield you from harm, brave traveler.
Hold on, friend. Is armor truly what you need? Protecting yourself may seem wise, but there’s strength in vulnerability as well.
Strength? Vulnerability leaves you exposed. Armor allows you to face your enemies without fear. Though, I won’t lie... it does come at a cost.
A cost? Indeed. Heavy armor will weigh you down, limiting your agility. You’ll feel its burden with every step, and perhaps find yourself slower to act in a moment of need.
True, but its protection is unmatched. Damage that would end a lesser warrior will glance off harmlessly. You’ll stand longer in battle, even if your movements are slower.
But walls keep out more than just harm. When you shield yourself, you distance yourself from those who would support you. To truly thrive, we must let others in.
Yet who would rely on a warrior who falls easily? Protection lets you fight another day, to stand strong beside your allies.
But if we always hide behind armor, our allies may never know us, never truly understand our struggles. Connection requires openness, not barriers.

dialogs.question: So, what will you do? Will you accept the armor for protection and endure its "weight", or foolishly trust in your openness with others and expose yourself vulnerability?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor for the added protection, even at the cost of agility.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll go without the protection and in trust in others.

dialogs.line: A wise choice, friend. May this armor protect you well in the trials to come. But remember... its weight is a burden you must carry.
I only hope that your armor doesn’t keep others at a distance. True strength isn’t always found behind steel.
A bold decision. I hope your allies are as reliable as you believe. Without armor, you’ll move swiftly, but you’ll need to rely on others for support.
Thank you. I believe that through trust and connection, you will find the strength to face whatever awaits.
